[Network]

This class is used to represent a connection to the server. More...

static const float & updateFrequency ()

Detailed Description

This class is used to represent a connection to the server.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ServerConnection::ServerConnection (  ) 

Constructor.

ServerConnection::~ServerConnection (  ) 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void ServerConnection::addCondemnedInterface ( Mercury::NetworkInterface *  pNetworkInterface  ) 

Adds the given network interface to the condemned list.

This list is cleared at the end of each call to processInput() when the network processing machinery is not actually in use.

Parameters:
pNetworkInterface The network interface to be destroyed.

void ServerConnection::addMove ( EntityID  id,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Vector3 &  pos,
float  yaw,
float  pitch,
float  roll,
bool  onGround,
const Vector3 &  globalPos 
)

This method adds a message to the server to inform it of the new position and direction (and the rest) of an entity under our control.

The server must have explicitly given us control of that entity first.

Parameters:
id ID of entity.
spaceID ID of the space the entity is in.
vehicleID ID of the innermost vehicle the entity is on.
pos Local position of the entity.
yaw Local direction of the entity.
pitch Local direction of the entity.
roll Local direction of the entity.
onGround Whether or not the entity is on terrain (if present).
globalPos Approximate global position of the entity

const Mercury::Address & ServerConnection::addr (  )  const

void ServerConnection::authenticate ( const ClientInterface::authenticateArgs &  args  ) 

This method authenticates the server to the client.

Its use is optional, and determined by the server that we are connected to upon login.

const MD5::Digest ServerConnection::digest (  )  const [inline]

void ServerConnection::digest ( const MD5::Digest &  digest  )  [inline]

void ServerConnection::disconnect ( bool  informServer = true  ) 

This method removes the channel.

This should be called when an exception occurs during processing input, or when sending data fails. The layer above can detect this by checking the online method once per frame. This is safer than using a callback, since a disconnect may happen at inconvenient times, e.g. when sending.

Mercury::EventDispatcher& ServerConnection::dispatcher (  )  [inline]

void ServerConnection::enableEntities (  ) 

This method enables the receipt of entity and related messages from the server, i.e.

the bulk of game traffic. The server does not start sending to us until we are ready for it. This should be called shortly after login.

void ServerConnection::enableReconfigurePorts (  )  [inline]

const std::string& ServerConnection::errorMsg (  )  const [inline]

void ServerConnection::forcedPosition ( const ClientInterface::forcedPositionArgs &  args  ) 

This method handles a forced position and direction update.

This is when an update is being forced back for an (ordinarily) client controlled entity, including for the player. Usually this is due to a physics correction from the server, but it could be for any reason decided by the server (e.g. server-initiated teleport).

data Stream containing message data.

LogOnStatus ServerConnection::logOn ( ServerMessageHandler *  pHandler,
const char *  serverName,
const char *  username,
const char *  password,
uint16  port = 0 
)

This method logs in to the named server with the input username and password.

Parameters:
pHandler The handler to receive messages from this connection.
serverName The name of the server to connect to.
username The username to log on with.
password The password to log on with.
publicKeyPath The path to locate the public key to use for encrypting login communication.
port The port that the server should talk to us on.

LoginHandlerPtr ServerConnection::logOnBegin ( const char *  serverName,
const char *  username,
const char *  password,
uint16  port = 0 
)

This method begins an asynchronous login.

LogOnStatus ServerConnection::logOnComplete ( LoginHandlerPtr  pLoginHandler,
ServerMessageHandler *  pHandler 
)

This method completes an asynchronous login.

Note: Don't call this from within processing the bundle that contained the reply if you have multiple ServConns, as it could stuff up processing for another of the ServConns.

bool ServerConnection::online (  )  const

This method returns whether or not we are online with the server.

If a login is in progress, it will still return false.

void ServerConnection::pLogOnParamsEncoder ( StreamEncoder *  pEncoder  )  [inline]

Set the logon params encoding method.

Parameters:
pEncoding The new encoding. This class takes no responsibility for deleting pEncoding.

StreamEncoder* ServerConnection::pLogOnParamsEncoder (  )  const [inline]

Return the logon params encoding method.

Returns:
The method used to encode the LogOnParams. NULL indicates that no encoding be used.

bool ServerConnection::processInput (  ) 

This method processes all pending network messages.

They are passed to the input handler that was specified in logOnComplete.

Returns:
Returns true if any packets were processed.

const double* ServerConnection::pTime (  )  [inline]

This method is used to return the pointer to current time.

It is used for server statistics and for syncronising between client and server time.

void ServerConnection::pTime ( const double *  pTime  ) 

This method is used to set the pointer to current time so that this object has access to the application's time.

It is used for server statistics and for syncronising between client and server time.

TODO: This needs to be reviewed.

void ServerConnection::registerInterfaces ( Mercury::NetworkInterface &  networkInterface  ) 

This private helper method registers the mercury interfaces with the provided network interface, so that it will serve them.

This should be done for every network interface that might receive messages from the server, which includes the temporary network interfaces used in the BaseApp login process.

void ServerConnection::relativePosition ( const ClientInterface::relativePositionArgs &  args  ) 

This method handles the relativePosition message.

It is used to indicate the position that should be used as the base for future relative positions.

void ServerConnection::relativePositionReference ( const ClientInterface::relativePositionReferenceArgs &  args  ) 

This method handles the relativePositionReference message.

It is used to indicate the position that should be used as the base for future relative positions.

void ServerConnection::requestEntityUpdate ( EntityID  id,
const CacheStamps &  stamps = CacheStamps() 
)

This method requests the server to send update information for the entity with the input id.

This must be called after receiving an onEntityEnter message to allow message and incremental property updates to flow.

Parameters:
id ID of the entity whose update is requested.
stamps A vector containing the known cache event stamps. If none are known, stamps is empty.

void ServerConnection::resetEntities ( const ClientInterface::resetEntitiesArgs &  args  ) 

This method handles a resetEntities call from the server.

The server is giving us a fragment of a resource that we have requested.

The header for a resource download from the server.

void ServerConnection::restoreClient ( BinaryIStream &  stream  ) 

This method handles a message from the server telling us that we need to restore a state back to a previous point.

This method sends the current bundle to the server.

void ServerConnection::sessionKey ( SessionKey  key  )  [inline]

void ServerConnection::setGameTime ( const ClientInterface::setGameTimeArgs &  args  ) 

This method handles a setGameTime message from the server.

It is used to adjust the current (server) game time.

void ServerConnection::setInactivityTimeout ( float  seconds  ) 

This method changes the default inactivity timeout.

If no packets are received for this amount of time, the connection will timeout and disconnect. This period is also used to calculate average packet loss. This method should be called before logging in.

Parameters:
seconds Inactivity timeout in seconds

void ServerConnection::setMessageHandler ( ServerMessageHandler *  pHandler  )  [inline]

void ServerConnection::setVehicle ( const ClientInterface::setVehicleArgs &  args  ) 

This method indicates that the vehicle an entity is on has changed.

EntityID  entityId

BinaryOStream & ServerConnection::startProxyMessage ( int  messageId  ) 

This method is called to start a new message to the proxy.

Note that proxy messages cannot be sent on a bundle after entity messages.

Parameters:
messageId The message to send.
Returns:
A stream to write the message on.

void ServerConnection::switchBaseApp ( BinaryIStream &  stream  ) 

This method is called when something goes wrong with the BaseApp and we need to recover.

void ServerConnection::tickSync ( const ClientInterface::tickSyncArgs &  args  ) 

This file contains the interface from the cell to the client.

It's called common_client_interface because it is common between client_interface.hpp and proxy_int_interface.hpp. These two interface files include this file to add these messages to those interfaces. They define the MF_BEGIN_COMMON_RELIABLE_MSG, MF_BEGIN_COMMON_PASSENGER_MSG, and MF_BEGIN_COMMON_UNRELIABLE_MSG macros to their interface specific macro.

This file is also used by proxy.hpp and server_connection.hpp for the declaration of the handler methods of these messages and is included by proxy.cpp to implement the pass-through handler methods of these messages.

void ServerConnection::updateEntity ( BinaryIStream &  stream  ) 

This method handles an updateEntity call from the server.

The frequency of updates from the server.

void ServerConnection::updateFrequencyNotification ( const ClientInterface::updateFrequencyNotificationArgs &  args  ) 

This method handles the message from the server that informs us how frequently it is going to send to us.
